page.title: 06'THE WYLAM GLOBE'
page.content: 'The Wylam Globe' is a quarterly newsletter produced by the Wylam Parish Council giving residents information about what the council is doing and other issues of general interest relating to the village. The first issue of the Globe was in July 1973.'The Globe' was chosen as the newsletters name due to links with two famous Wylam families.One of the early locomotives built by Timothy Hackworth was called the 'The Globe'. 'The Globe' was also a famous newspaper in the nineteenth century and one for which J.F.B. Blacket,who became M.P. for Newcastle,and was a member of the family who were the 'squires of Wylam' for nearly 300 years from 1679 to 1971,was a frequent and distinguished contributor.
